page.title: 01 WEEDON BEC-AN INTRODUCTION.
page.content: Weedon Bec consists of three sections;Road Weedon,Upper Weedon and Weedon Bec.Road Weedon grew up around {Watling Street} and was originally known as Weedon-on-the-Street. Weedon became more important when on the 21 June 1796 the {Grand Junction canal} was opened,crossing the village on a high embankment. On 14 June 1804 the large {Royal Military Depot} was begun.Three royal pavillions were built for {King George III} and his cabinet in case Napoleon invaded this Country. In September 1838 the {London & Birmingham Railway} was opened through the village.A siding served the depot. Weedon is now a prosperous village with a wide range of facilities.Many of the inhabitants work in London or Northampton.
